# Prepare submission

This section guides authors through the steps needed to prepare and submit an Evidence preprint. 

::::::{important}

This documentation is **NOT** designed to explain authoring tools of MyST markdown.

:::{card}
:header: ðŸ”— Visit MyST Markdown Docs
:link: https://mystmd.org/guide/typography

Visit the official guide to explore all the powerful tools available for writing a beautiful preprint.
:::

:::::{seealso} For a quick look at MySTâ€™s capabilities, try it yourself!
:class: dropdown

You can make changes on the left panel to update the preview on the right in realtime. 
* Explore typography features, and some authoring tools MyST has to offer!
* See how easily your content can be converted between multiple formats. 

You can copy paste the following `button` role after the frontmatter (after the second `---`) to begin with.

:::{code}

{button}`Evidence Webpage <https://evidencepub.io>`

:::


::::{iframe} https://mystmd.org/sandbox?tab=demo&%%3D%3D
:width: 100%

Demo adapted from the MyST documentation. You can edit in fullscreen [here](https://mystmd.org/sandbox?tab=demo&%%3D%3D)
::::
:::::

::::::

## Determine the kind of your submission

All Evidence preprints are built from a collection of Markdown (and optionally Jupyter Notebook) files organized following a valid MyST layout. To help you get started quickly, we have prepared templates for a streamlined quickstart.

However, it is instrumental to first determine the **kind of Evidence** you'd like to publish. 

Simply follow the decision tree below:


:::{mermaid}
flowchart TD
    Start([Start: What are you publishing?]) --> Focus{Is this education<br/>or research focused?}

    Focus -->|Education| Tutorial["Kind: Interactive Tutorial"]

    Focus -->|Research| HasCode{Does your preprint<br/>include code or data?}

    HasCode -->|No| Abstract["Kind: Abstract, Summary,<br/>or Literature Review"]

    HasCode -->|Yes| HasData{Does it include<br/>input data?}

    HasData -->|No| CodeOnly["Kind: Computational<br/>Basic code examples"]

    HasData -->|Yes| NeedsKernel{Does it need an<br/>active kernel to<br/>generate outputs?}

    NeedsKernel -->|No| Interactive["Kind: Interactive<br/>Offline interactive<br/>e.g., Plotly"]

    NeedsKernel -->|Yes| WantsDashboard{Do you want to<br/>deploy a live<br/>dashboard?}

    WantsDashboard -->|No| Computational["Kind: Computational<br/>Code execution<br/>required"]

    WantsDashboard -->|Yes| Dashboard["Kind: Dashboard-Boosted<br/>Interactive Article<br/>Live dashboard"]

    style Start fill:#e1f5ff
    style Tutorial fill:#ffe1ff
    style Abstract fill:#ffe1e1
    style Interactive fill:#e1ffe1
    style Computational fill:#fff4e1
    style Dashboard fill:#f0e1ff
    style CodeOnly fill:#fff4e1
:::

:::{hint}
The decision tree above is prepared using the [mermaid directive](https://mystmd.org/guide/diagrams). One of the many MyST authoring tools! 
:::
